page.title: 08LOCAL INDUSTRIES
page.content: Booths is a factory which is situated in the townland of Ballynany. This factory sells dried calf, cow and horse nuts. At the minute Booths employs fourteen people but this number always increases in the wintertime because a larger number of people are needed to look after the cows in the shed. Inside the factory are conveyor belts which bring the bags of meal out from the interior of the factory and drops them on a lorry. Booths was established in 1906 and the industry is still thriving today, attracting customers from as far away as Enniskillen. Cootes is an engineering works in the Lisdoart area. It is not an industry on a large scale but only employs three or four people.
